snippet: The growth from movie and cable businesses helped fuel a 9 percent increase in revenue to $7.5 billion, from $6.9 billion during the same period a year ago.
abstract: Time Warner reports that its first-quarter profit increased 7 percent, leading to a 9 percent increase in revenue, to $7.5 billion, from $6.9 billion during the same period in 2013; net profit rose to $1.5 billion, compared with $1.4 billion a year earlier; earnings per share were 97 cents.
lead_paragraph: The growth from movie and cable businesses helped fuel a 9 percent increase in revenue to $7.5 billion, from $6.9 billion during the same period a year ago.

headline.main: Time Warner’s Profit Rises On Strength in Film Unit
headline.print_headline: Time Warner’s Profit Rises on Strength in Film Unit
